definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound

sentences.english: When you are single, your love affairs are hardly news.
sentences.chinese: 当你单身时，你的风流韵事是重要新闻。

sentences.english: Kids, there's more than one story of how I met your mother.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们，在我遇到你老妈前风流韵事不止一次。
他们的风流韵事变得明显了。

sentences.english: He always embellishes his romantic escapades.
sentences.chinese: 他总是大肆渲染他的风流韵事。

sentences.english: She will run on for hours about her romantic deeds.
sentences.chinese: 提起她的风流韵事她能连续讲好几个小时。

sentences.english: A romance happened in his family.
sentences.chinese: 他家里发生了一件风流韵事。

sentences.english: It's difficult to head her off when she talked about her dissolute life.
sentences.chinese: 要是她谈起她的风流韵事来，你就别想岔开她的话题。

sentences.english: Gallantry like that no longer exists.
sentences.chinese: 那样的风流韵事不再存在了。

sentences.english: Her personal life set a Hollywood standard for glamour and tumult.
sentences.chinese: 她的个人生活成为好莱坞风流韵事的标尺。

sentences.english: She achieved notoriety for her affair with the senator.
sentences.chinese: 她因为和参议员的风流韵事而声名狼藉。

sentences.english: Peter had many love-affairs before he married.
sentences.chinese: 彼得结婚前有过许多风流韵事。

sentences.english: There s dirt on the affair between Jessica abd the manager.
sentences.chinese: 关于杰西卡和经理之间的风流韵事，流言满天飞。

sentences.english: You may be tempted to get involved in secret affairs or love triangles.
sentences.chinese: 可能会纠缠进风流韵事或者三角恋中。

sentences.english: There are rumours and slanders canarding about her romantic deeds.
sentences.chinese: 关于她的风流韵事有许多流言蜚语正在流传着。

definition: poetic occasion/elegant situation/in literature, the cue for a poem
distinguished and accomplished/outstanding/talented in letters and unconventional in lifestyle/romantic/dissolute/loose
anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
lit. love debt/fig. moral obligation in consequence of a love affair/karmic consequences of a love affair
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
lit. to enjoy the beautiful spring scenery (idiom)/fig. to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
